Before starting the degree program | During the degree program | Contact

----------------------------------------

Application Deadline
Informatics: Games Engineering > Application Deadline
Winter semester: 15 May to 15 July
Summer semester: 15 November to 15 January (only entry into the 2nd or higher semester of enrollment in current degree program)
Application Deadline
----------------------------------------

Examinations and examination regulations
Informatics: Games Engineering > Examinations and examination regulations
Detailed information can be found at Examinations.
The General Academic and Examination Regulations (APSO) of TUM and the respective program-specific Academic and Examination Regulations (FPSO) apply to all students:
FPSO of 16 October 2023: valid for students who commenced their studies during or after the winter semester 2023/24
FPSO of 15 October 2018, as amended on 13 May 2022: valid for students who commenced their studies during or after the winter semester 2022/23
FPSO of 15 October 2018: valid for students who commenced their studies during or after the winter semester 2018/19
FPSO of 3 May 2011, as amended on 2 September 2016: valid for students who commenced their studies during or after the winter semester 2016/17, but before summer semester 2018
FPSO of 3 May 2011, as amended on 20 August 2014: valid for students who commenced their studies during or after the winter semester 2014/15
FPSO of 3 May 2011, as amended on 6 November 2013: valid for students who commenced their studies during or after the winter semester 2013/14
Examinations and examination regulations
----------------------------------------

Degree
Informatics: Games Engineering > Degree
After you have completed the required achievements and have submitted your thesis, you will graduate with a bachelor of Science (B.Sc.). This will enable you to start your career or start a master’s degree program. Tips and tricks on graduation and your next steps can be found under Degree.
Degree
